name: Ultra Tracker Module
summary: Learn about .ULT files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Ultra Tracker was popular among users of the Gravis UltraSound soundcard, which offered high-quality sample-based audio playback. Musicians used Ultra Tracker to compose multi-channel music optimized for this hardware. Over time, other music trackers, such as MikMod, added support for the ULT format, allowing users to continue playing it despite the eventual discontinuation of the original software.

Later versions of Ultra Tracker introduced the .UNI format, which provided enhanced composition features and replaced ULT as the software’s primary module format. While different versions of Ultra Tracker may save ULT files with slight variations, most modern module players that support the ULT format can play all versions.

instructions: You can open ULT files with VideoLAN VLC media player (multiplatform), MikMod (multiplatform), Nullsoft Winamp (Windows), and Vitamin/CAIG ZXTune (multiplatform). To open a ULT file with VLC media player, select Media → Open File.
VideoLAN VLC media player can convert ULT files to various file types, including the following audio formats:
